segments.text: I see a woman standing by the sink, completely unaware of the water overflowing around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, but she just keeps drying that plate like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the children behind her, reaching for cookies, and she doesn’t even turn around.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is standing on a wobbly stool, and it looks like it’s about to tip over any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting for a cookie, not even noticing how dangerous this whole situation is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman should really turn around and see what’s happening before someone gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring onto the floor, and she doesn’t even seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s just too focused on her chores or if she’s completely oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels like a disaster waiting to happen, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everything looks outside the window while chaos unfolds inside.
segments.speaker: PAR
